title: Information Problem-Solving (IPS) Competency Enhancement Education for [Large-Scale] Science Field Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational scientific knowledge and general information retrieval skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, designed to systematically resolve information challenges faced by science practitioners during work, with project-based assessments verifying real-world application skills

learning_goals: Learners can define information problems in real-world science scenarios and decompose them into analyzable steps
Learners can apply procedures to evaluate and curate digital information sources to derive credible scientific evidence
Learners can systematically document and present information problem-solving outcomes through collaboration with peers and advisors

resources: Access rights to science subject information source databases
Step-by-step IPS (Instructional Process System) worksheet templates
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
